author: Brian Lisik,special to Sun News
title: Man caught after stealing more than $1,100 from Walmart: Avon Police Blotter
text:
Patrick Cooley/NEOMG Theft, Chester Road: A man was arrested with $1,117.75 worth of stolen merchandise after police were called to a Walmart store at 12:50 p.m. Sept. 1. Theft, Detroit Road: Police responded to a theft at Kohl's in Avon Commons at 1:58 p.m. Aug. 28. Witnesses said the suspect left the area in a black Ford Focus. The car was later stopped and the suspect was arrested.
Disturbance, Detroit Road: Police were called to a disturbance at Costco in Avon Commons at 1:17 p.m. Aug. 28. The victim said one of the men involved in the fight pointed a gun at him. The suspect was arrested for aggravated menacing.
Breaking and entering, Detroit Road: Management at Parkview Landscaping reported a break-in and theft of lawn furniture between 8 p.m. Aug. 26 and 5 a.m. Aug. 27.
Vandalism, Moore Road: Police found cases of vandalism at three locations, the Knights of Columbus, Vasu Communications and Northgate Park between Aug. 21 and Aug. 23 that the department believes are related. The case was still under investigation at the time of the report.
Drunken driver, Detroit/Ridgeland roads: A woman was arrested at 5:10 p.m. Aug. 21 for operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated after police received a call of a possible intoxicated driver.
Theft, Detroit Road: Avon city employees reported the theft of batteries from the portable traffic signal on Long Road sometime between 1 a.m. and 6:54 a.m. Aug. 19.
Theft, Colorado Avenue: A resident at The Woods of French Creek reported $300 in cash stolen from her room at 3:45 p.m. Aug. 18. Police had no suspects at the time of the report.
